tuv.seg: A woman who is experiencing low risk pregnancy may choose to have a home birth
Féadfaidh bean a bhfuil toircheas ísealriosca aici a roghnú chun breith ar a leanbh sa bhaile
The Health Service Executive (HSE) has a National Home Birth Service for eligible expectant mothers who wish to have a home birth under the care of a self-employed community midwife (SECM)

Tá Seirbhís Náisiúnta um Breith Bhaile ag Feidhmeannacht na Seirbhíse Sláinte do mháithreacha incháilithe atá ag súil le leanbh ar mian leo breith ar a leanbh sa bhaile faoi chúram bean chabhrach pobail fhéinfhostaithe (BCPF)
In some HSE areas the service may be available through a maternity hospital or a HSE scheme
I roinnt ceantar de FSS, d’fhéadfadh an tseirbhís a bheith ar fáil trí ospidéal máithreachais nó trí scéim FSS
However in other HSE areas, only private SECMs are available to attend a home birth – see ‘How to apply’ below
Ach i gceantair eile de FSS, áfach, níl fáil ach ar BCPFanna príobháideacha chun freastal ar bhreith bhaile – féach ‘Conas iarratas a dhéanamh’ thíos
If you want to avail of the National Home Birth Service, you will first need to contact your Local Health Office
Más mian leat fáil a bheith agat ar an tSeirbhís Náisiúnta um Breith Bhaile, beidh ort teagmháil a dhéanamh, i dtosach, le d’Oifig Áitiúil Sláinte
You will be put through to the designated official who is a qualified midwife
Atreorófar thú chuig an oifigeach sannta ar bean chabhrach cháilithe í
You will be sent an information pack
Seolfar pacáiste faisnéise chugat
You then contact a self-employed community midwife (SECM)
Déanann tú teagmháil leis an mbean chabhrach pobail fhéinfhostaithe (BCPF) ansin
You and the midwife should fill out an application form for the service
Ba cheart duit féin agus an bhean chabhrach foirm iarratais a chomhlánú don tseirbhís
You send the form to the designated official who will assess your eligibility for the service
Seolann tú an fhoirm chuig an oifigeach sannta a dhéanfaidh measúnú ar do theidlíocht don tseirbhís
If your application is accepted, this will entitle you to free antenatal, delivery and postnatal services
Má ghlactar le d’iarratas, beidh tú i dteideal seirbhísí saor in aisce réamhbhreithe, breithe agus iarbhreithe a fháil
The HSE will also provide you with a Home Birth Pack with all you will need for a home delivery
Anuas air sin, soláthróidh FSS Pacáiste um Breith Bhaile duit ina mbeidh gach a dteastóidh uait le haghaidh breith bhaile
You can find more information about the process in Appendix 4 Pathway of Care on hse.ie
Is féidir leat teacht ar thuilleadh faisnéise faoin bpróiseas in Aguisín 4 Conair Chúraim (‘Pathway of Care’) ar dfa.ie
Alternatively, you can engage a self-employed community midwife (SECM) privately and your antenatal, delivery and postnatal care will be provided by them
Mar mhalairt air sin, féadfaidh tú bean chabhrach pobail fhéinfhostaithe (BCPF) a fhostú go príobháideach agus soláthróidh siad do chúram réamhbhreithe, breithe agus iarbhreithe
If you are using maternity services provided by a hospital or HSE scheme, they are provided free of charge
Má tá seirbhísí máithreachais a sholáthraíonn ospidéal nó scéim FSS á n-úsáid agat, soláthraítear iad saor in aisce
Many private health insurers provide a grant towards the cost of a home birth
Soláthraíonn go leor árachóirí sláinte príobháideacha deontas i dtreo costas breith bhaile
If you wish to have a home birth, you need to decide this as early as possible in your pregnancy
Más mian leat tabhairt faoi bhreith bhaile, is gá duit an cinneadh seo a dhéanamh a luaithe is féidir i do thoircheas
Contact your Local Health Office or contact a self-employed community midwife (SECM) through the Homebirth Association of Ireland
Déan teagmháil le d’Oifig Sláinte Áitiúil nó déan teagmháil le bean chabhrach pobail fhéinfhostaithe (BCPF) trí Chumann um Breith Bhaile na hÉireann
